column4: hey all, i've just managed to get ubuntu running alongside XP home on my machine, and it seems to be working flawlessly apart from one thing: the wireless internet

im using an RALinnk 2500 card, connecting to a linksys WRT54GS router connected to a cable modem. ubuntu sees the card and lets me connect to the network, but the internet over wireless doesnt work, any ideas?
->  whats the make of your card?
firefox, but synaptic etc... dont work either
->  you getting a connection - should be a green blob thingie on the top right?
i dont recall so. i can "activate" the card is what i meant then, i suppose
->  sounds like a WEP problem.   disable the WEP on your router and then try it.
esteth ->  or you can enter your WEP key.
i have entered my wep key, it wouldnt even activate before i entered it, at least from the liveCD
esteth -> ah.   you need to first DEACTIVATE ...  then enter the wep and then ACTIVATE...
esteth -> i've come across that before. think its a bit of a bug.
so i make sure that the card is deactivated, then enter the wep key, then activate, and it should work?
came across it on  a blog somewhere.  might work for you.
weird. i should probably mention im running dapper drake, not eft atm
ok. im going to reboot into ubuntu now, and try that
